title: Laura M. Bandi
text:
Hi there! My name is Laura Bandi and I am a first-year PhD student in Psychological Science at Toronto Metropolitan University (TMU) studying under the supervision of Dr. Alyssa Counsell in the Psychology And Statistics Education Research (PASER) Lab.
Research Interests

Differences in statistical literacy across fields of study and education levels
Post-secondary students’ self-efficacy in learning statistics and attitudes towards statistics
Improving statistics and research methods courses in the social sciences
Psychometrics and scale development
Scholarship of teaching and learning

title: PASER Lab
text: To learn more about Dr. Counsell’s research, visit the PASER Lab Website

York University, 2022

title: Research
text: Counsell, A., Halili-Sychangco, D., Crone, G., & Bandi, L. (in prep). Statistics courses in psychology undergraduate programs: A review of Canadian institutions. Target outlet: Canadian Psychology

title: Research
text:
Presentations

Bandi, L., Halili-Sychangco, D., Crone, G., & Counsell, A. (2024, June 21-23). The state of undergraduate statistics courses: Are we teaching modern skills in psychology? In R. Cribbie (Chair), Rethinking the Teaching of Statistics for Student Betterment [Symposium]. 85th Annual Canadian Psychological Association Convention, Ottawa, ON, Canada.
Bandi, L. (2024, March 26). Exploring statistical literacy: Measures, psychological factors, and pedagogical approaches [Area talk]. Toronto Metropolitan University Social Area Meeting (SAM), Toronto, ON, Canada.
